article.title: About Saxon/C
article.p: Saxon/C is a cross-compiled variant of Saxon from the Java platform to the C/C++ platform, with extensions for PHP and Python. All features of Saxon have been ported, other than those (such as collations) that are necessarily platform dependent. In particular, Saxon/C provides processing in XSLT, XQuery and XPath, and Schema validation. It therefore makes these processing capabilities available to a plethora of other languages that are strongly coupled to C/C++ such as PHP, Perl, Python, and Ruby. (For instance, saxon-node uses Saxon/C to create an interface with with node.js.)

Saxon/C 1.2.1 is the latest release of the opensource Saxon-HE/C and the commercial products Saxon-PE/C and Saxon-EE/C on the C/C++, PHP and Python programming platforms. The APIs support the specifications XSLT 3.0, XQuery 3.1, Schema Validation 1.0/1.1 and XPath 3.1.
See the comparison matrix to compare the HE/PE/EE products.
Saxon/C standards conference follows the W3C languages specifications for XSLT, XQuery, Schema Validation and XPath, which is described in the Saxon-J documentation
Saxon/C is built from the Saxon 9.9.1.5 Java product using Excelsior JET Enterprise 15.3 edition (MP1).
Platforms supported: Linux 64-bit, Mac OS and Windows 64-bit.
Saxon/C is released in three separate editions, as on the Java platform: Enterprise Edition (Saxon-EE/C), Professional Edition (Saxon-PE/C), and Home Edition (Saxon-HE/C)
